page.title: 15TRANSPORT - RURAL
page.content: BEING A RURAL AREA PUBLIC TRANSPORT HAS BEEN REDUCED OVER RECENT YEARS DUE MAINLY TO LACK OF SUPPORT. IN SPRATTON THE BUS SERVICE IS VERY POOR. THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY FIVE BUSES PER DAY INTO NORTHAMPTON. BECAUSE OF THE PROBLEMS WITH PUBLIC TRANSPORT, THERE IS A HIGH RATIO OF CAR OWNERSHIP IN THE AREA. MOST FAMILIES OWN ONE CAR AND APPROXIMATELY 25% ARE TWO CAR FAMILIES. TEENAGERS ARE PARTICULARLY AFFECTED BY THE LACK OF PUBLIC TRANSPORT AS THERE IS VERY LITTLE SOCIAL LIFE FOR THEM IN THE VILLAGES. MANY OWN MOPEDS AND SMALL MOTORBIKES WHICH THEY MAY LEGALLY RIDE AT THE AGE OF SIXTEEN. A DAILY SCHOOL BUS IS PROVIDED FOR OLDER CHILDREN WHO ATTEND GUILSBOROUGH COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL BUT PRIMARY SCHOOL CHILDREN ENJOY NO SUCH PROVISION.
